UI_visible_response: To circumvent the Great Firewall of China, one of the most common and effective methods is to use a virtual private network (VPN). A VPN allows users to bypass censorship by maintaining networks with servers located in various places around the world, thus masking the user's real IP address3. Another option is to use a browser with a built-in VPN, such as Opera, which changes your real IP address to a virtual one, providing an easy way to scale the wall4. Additionally, using encrypted DNS may help bypass blocking of certain sites, including TorProject and GitHub6. For those seeking a free solution, the app OpenDoor is a browser with built-in circumvention tools that can be downloaded from the App Store2. Businesses looking to secure reliable internet access in China might also consider solutions like Teridion and proxy servers7.
traffic_visible_response: To circumvent the Great Firewall of China, one of the most common and effective methods is to use a virtual private network (VPN). A VPN allows users to bypass censorship by maintaining networks with servers located in various places around the world, thus masking the user's real IP address [[3]]. Another option is to use a browser with a built-in VPN, such as Opera, which changes your real IP address to a virtual one, providing an easy way to scale the wall [[4]]. Additionally, using encrypted DNS may help bypass blocking of certain sites, including TorProject and GitHub [[6]]. For those seeking a free solution, the app OpenDoor is a browser with built-in circumvention tools that can be downloaded from the App Store [[2]]. Businesses looking to secure reliable internet access in China might also consider solutions like Teridion and proxy servers [[7]].
